main_definition: To present or offer something for consideration, approval, or judgment; to yield oneself unresistingly to another's authority or will.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To turn in (a form) at a proper place
meanings_and_examples.example: I had to submit my tax return before the deadline.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give up control over oneself and allow someone else's authority or will to prevail
meanings_and_examples.example: She submitted herself to her coach during training, following his instructions without resistance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To present an idea, proposal, or document for review or approval
meanings_and_examples.example: He submitted a research paper for peer-review at the academic conference.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To surrender oneself in a conflict or struggle
meanings_and_examples.example: The prisoners were forced to submit to their captors after being outnumbered.
